name: Pensiunea Floare de Crin
description: 4 star hotel with good value food. They let us camp in their car park

name: Restaurant near Bicaz
description: We were allowed to camp in the car park

name: Vidraru dam
description:
Moderator Note: This Place is deleted as it is a duplicate of Place 13812.

A small paved bit on the side of Vidraru dam. During the day there are small vendors selling various stuff, quiet during night. Night guards went to check and told us we can stay here. :)
During the season there is also bungee jump available, sadly it wasn't there when we were there.

name: Vidraru dam
description:
A small paved bit on the side of Vidraru dam. During the day there are small vendors selling various stuff, quiet during night. Night guards went to check and told us we can stay here. :)
During the season there is also bungee jump available, sadly it wasn't there when we were there.

name: Free camp alongside Transfagarasan
description: Another free camp spot on the Transfagarasan, a few other people were here.

name: Transfagarasan
description:
"The best driving road in the world" - words from the Top Gear. Amazing drive, altitude around 2000km, interesting history of the road and a beautiful sunset. The road is only open during the summer, roughly around july-september, best to check online before so there is no snow. 
Busy during the day, to enjoy some driving it's best to go early morning or before sunset. Free camping along the road.

name: Transalpina
description:
Our favourite road in Romania. Stunning drive, almost no traffic compared to more famous Transfagarasan. South of Obârşia Lotrului very good paved road, to the north some parts were still gravel (2014), but worth it.
Extremely picturesque, great to drive, many options to wild camp - almost anywhere by the road, just take your pick.

name: Wild camp around Lake Bolboci
description:
Went here just our of curiosity, there is a huge lake / dam. Near to beautiful national park Bucegi.
Some beautiful freshly built paved roads(with some gravel ones too) on the road from Sinaia to here, almost completely deserted - met about 3 other cars. Go to the area if you like exploring :)

name: Popas Donaris
description: Established campsite. Set in lovely grounds. Great food at onsite restaurant. Bar. €15 on suite cabin.Campsite/ cottages/ restaurant Donaris: 15 euro, all facilities, extremely noisy during weekend (all night, no sleep!) on grass, clean showers.

name: Dracula camping, Bran
description: The biggest asset of this campground is the location near Bran castle. The disadvantage (especially in high season): it's cramped and visited by large camper groups that think they own the campground and act accordingly. If possible chose a site between hedges so they won't hook up 1 meter from your site. Price: around 16 euro without electricity in high season.

name: Minicamping Minis.
description: Small campground with lots of space on route to and from Hungary - Romania. Clean facilities.

name: Doua Lumi (two worlds) in Blajel
description: Small campground with swimming pool and a Dutch couple (the owners) that take every effort to make your holiday a feast. Very personal approach. Lovely surroundings (close to beautiful Sigisoara).

name: Camping Bradova Barsana
description:
A nice little Campground with a perfect few.
Very nice owners and setting. Easy to access 
You decide what you pay if you sleep there in a car. 
Hot showers, fridge, electricity, Internet (wifi)

close to one of the famous wooden churches.

name: wild camp at the river
description:
we camped at this nice place which you can access in 2 ways: cross the small river (ca. 20cm deep) or drive around and access from above. We did the crossing which was easy.

The place is close to the street but not visible. There are 2 fire pits and a lot of wood around. The river is only a few meters away. Quiet at night, tent friendly, no other amenities.

name: Camping Arges
description: Menu pricing. 30 lei per night per person (camping) and 20 lei per night per car. No charge for the motorcycles. They have small cabins as well. Lots of hot water and clean bathrooms. There is a kitchen to use as well as inside and outside common hangout areas. There is coffee too. There is a pond. Great owners. There is a refrigerator you can use as well. Great place. There is a place for charging items in the common area

name: A view from the top of the world
description:
Forget about the other options on Transfargarasan! 

We found this place when we walked up to the viewpoint with the cross on its Top. If you have good weather, you can wake up in the morning with a view of 100+ Km's 

To find it, turn off the main road at the parking lot and drive towards cabana balea lac. just before you would turn right to park in front of the cabana, take the small bumpy dirtroad on the left up towards the viewpoint. On the right of the viewpoint is a little platform where we camped. It sais that you can only camp here, if you pay parking. We asked in the Cabana and they said that someone will come and charge us (15Lp.P.), which didn't happen. 

It's windy up there, so bring warm clothes for the evening. 
Restaurant available in Cabana Balea Lac I
Toilets in Restaurant!

name: Camping Ananas
description:
A quiet Campground, run by germans. Hot showers, fast wifi and lots of level spots. 2 People and a van:54 Lei

Has everything that you would expect from a campground

15 Minutes by car to Sibiu, 3 Minutes to the local village with a fortress and a church as sightseeing-options!

name: Salisteanca
description: 40 lieu for two people, two motorcycles and a tent. Nice place. Clean bathrooms with plenty of hot water. There is a hot plate and hang out area that is covered.

name: Vidraru Dam
description: Lake side

name: Petru Rares
description: Wild Camping

name: Sibiu
description: bus car park just in front of the old city.

name: Tourist Information Centre Vama
description: A place for information for the local region Tara Oasului and Maramures. A good photographic exhibition of local people also traditional clothing, jewellery, ceramics and rugs. Very friendly lady Mihaela Grigorean. Bicycles for rent for bicycle tours. Good maps and local knowledge. Very good potter nearby for purchasing. Information centre open 10:00 until 18:00 Monday to Friday. Nice picnic table outside. Craft stalls open the first day of the month in the car park.

name: Camp ground near Cave Topolniţa
description: Flat ground next to the river. Dirt track to this place is next to a house, there is Red white triangles marked on trees. Track is suitable for 4X4 and motorcycles. You can follow the markings on rocks and trees and trek to Cave Topolniţa entrance.

name: CFF Tourist Train Station Camp Ground Viseu de Sus
description: Camping area at the train station parking area. 30RON (7.50€) with good wifi, toilets and showers, or 40RON with power and water. Set in a pretty valley on the outskirts of the town. Nice little cafe too and maccommodation in the hotel train. They offer train trip packages that can include accommodation and meals. Tourist steam train ride into the countryside at this site.

name: Trout Farm
description:
Trout farm past the Namaesti Monastry. They will allow camping in return for having dinner at the restaurant. 
Great food, not expensive (7 lei per 100 grams of trout). 
It is an informal campsite, you can camp in the parking lot or on the far end of the farm, but there is construction going on right now in that part. Hot shower and toilet available in the restaurant!

Be warned, it gets really busy during the weekends! During the week it is quiet. 

Great hiking in the area. (Also, for wild camping, continue up the road past the Trout Farm and there are some great spots. 4wd recommended)

name: Casa Sighisoreana
description:
Nice hotel, big rooms, hot showers, good wifi, walking distance to the city centre, secure parking on the property and a nice kitchen to use! The Overlander Dream after a few cold and rainy nights! ;) 

Nico, the owner, is a very friendly guy who made us feel right at home. 

It was low season when we were there, so we paid 80 RON on a weekday and 100 RON during the weekend. Still very cheap compared to other accommodation and even camping in the area!

name: Topolniţa Cave Entrace
description: Short trek from the near by campsite. Cave exploration requires equipments and guide as water level can be high at times.

name: Free Sulphur Hot Spring
description: Two pools, it is free to enter. It believed to be good for bones. Kids are not recommended to enter because their bones are still developing. There are some cubicles for changing

name: Free Spring Water at Băile Herculane
description: Băile Herculane is believed to be the place where Hercules bathed and regained his strength. Water from this spring has low mineral and believed to have therapeutic effects. My friend told me it is flows over some silver ore so the water is low in microbes too. Many people come from far to collect water from this spring including my host.

name: wild camp near donau delta
description: next to a river. field with grass and trees. you have to find the path left of the main road and drive 500 meters along the river.  quit place with only the fishing boats who will pass and see you.

name: near Mangalia.
description: big grassy field next to the river. over the bridge to the right if you came from the coast. lots of garbage but that is everywhere in Romania 😕.

name: near Muddy Volcano
description: campground on gras, 25 Lei/ night, we get allowence to stay in a parking lot in front of for 10 Lei/night, to muddy volcano just a short walk, extra pay for showers

name: Glavoi Camping
description: Official Campground in national park. it is for free. next to it are a couple of small restaurants and a park rescue service station. there is no owner since it is a designated camping area by the national park. no services whatsoever available apart from the food stalls.

name: Camping Parking Lot @ Muddy Volcanoes
description: Huge Parking lot. camping possible for free!

name: Dan Camping Fischer
description: good established campground, cheap,washing machine

name: Camping Turul
description: Quiet shady spots. Good WiFi. Immaculate amenities.

name: Camping De Oude Wilg
description:
nice big camping clean and fine food store 100 meters away

Cirta nr. 311
557070, Jud. Sibiu, Romania
Tel:0040(0)723 186 343
GPS: N 45 47,033 - E24 34,024
E-mail de_oude_wilg@yahoo.com
WWW.campingdeoudewilg.nl

name: Wild camp at the lake
description: Flattish opening between the road and the lake. We arrived very late in the dark after 10pm. Very few cars came past during the night. A few more in the morning from 6am. You're out in the open but it's a good spot for one night. The road is steep & twisty and mainly good asphalt. Any vehicle should make it here - we saw a car towing caravan, too.

name: beautiful sites near restaurants
description:
There are plenty of beautiful spots after two restaurants, which got decent WiFi. 
There are a lot of Romanias who also camp here at the weekend.

name: Fereastra Zmeilor Refugio
description:
Small and basic Refugio on 2050m above sea level. 
Lovely view over the valley and the mountain range. Takes officially 90mins to hike up but took us 45mins.

name: field in the forest
description:
A gravel road, which turns off on the top of the mountain, leads to a field in the forest. 
There are about three spots which are even and also have a fire ring. 
If it's too close to the road for you, follow the track into the forest and after a few hundred metres there's another field.

name: deserted footballfield
description:
A even spot near a deserted footballfield. 
The road is not very busy but audible when a car is passing. 
It's fine to overnight but nothing more.

name: Mureş River under bridge
description:
Great place full of locals swimming
Toilets
Bins 
Swimming
Close to local restaurant
Some road noise, but nothing major
Good wee spot

name: Cabana Haihvi
description:
lovely old house with several rooms sleeping 2 or 3 people.  bathroom shared.
we paid £12.50gdp for 2 people including breakfast.
evening meal available on request.

hosts speak no English so have Google translate at the ready.

really lovely stop for the night :)

name: View over Tulcea
description: Place with an amazing view, a bit windy though. Not suitable for big campers or bad cars, since it's a bit offroad. Very calm spot.

name: Babou Maramures
description:
It's the most beautiful camping I have ever been to in my life. Very beautiful view, amazing owners, facilities clean and very nice, too. The place makes you feel at home, it has a real soul. The road is not asphalt, but gravel. Be careful to take the right way (not GPS). Nice hikes and day trips from here.

Restaurants are in the village.

name: Valley by Busteni
description:
A river on one side, forest on the other and in between meadows that are great for camping. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon in late July and the place was packed! I'm talking 1000s of Romanians with their caravans or tents! So privacy & tranquility are low, but on the upside you're not alone and might make some friends. Our neighbor shared their homemade booze with us...
few portaloos scattered around but definitely not enough for all the ppl there. So the forest ist being used as ablution block.
As we left sunday morning, there was an official at the entrance to the valley & it looked like ppl had to pay to get in and were handed rubbish bags. I can't imagine the fee would have been high.
There are said to be many many bears in the area. But i think with all the ppl there, loud music & fires they would not be very interested in visiting this valley. may be very different in off season.

name: Pensiunea Cristina - Mila 23
description:
From Tulcea, take A transfer by boat with "pelicanul express", centrally located at the harbor (call Micha -speaks French ) to get to Mila 23, a picturesque and authentic fishermen village. 

Safe parking on far side of Harbor.

Rent a kayak (info at discover Danube delta website or call Goean at 0763 869 400) 

During the transfer you can ask Micha to call ahead for a place to stay. We stayed at Cristina's pension - who speaks English and French - morning coffee included. Typical Diner can be arranged on the spot.

Wildcamp in the Danube delta.

name: Grassy valley
description: Long grassy valley, heaps of space. Fisherman and picnics during the day.

name: Bear camp
description: Definately worth staying. A lot of people just come to visit Lake Ana during the day. But it is at night the magic happens. Brown bears. At dusk it is best to go to the lake. When everybody leaves, the bears come out. Be careful when walking back, we got cut off by a mama bear with cubs. At night they wandering around too, you will hear the dogs reacting to them and if they come to close the rangers will shoot (in the air). In the morning you might see them around the campsite. The big field across the street used to be open for (free) camping, but due to too much dirt left behind this is now closed - hopefully it will open again in the future. The campsite itself has 1 cold shower, toilets, firewoord and a 2m high electric fence :-) 50ron per night. In season there is a little grill restaurant.

name: River Beach
description: On the main road you can geta dirty road that goes to the river and there are plenty of space to camp next to the river. Beautiful view and quiet place, despite there are a few firepits with some trash.

name: Free Picnic And Camping Zone
description: After dirty road there is a free picnic and camping zone. Nice and quiet area at the river and mountains around with tables and fire pit.

name: Vladimir pension
description: very beautiful and quiet place. Vladimir is very nice and can learn you lot of things, he speak french, english, russian. 20 or 30 lei per night with electricity

name: in the land
description: very big flat place where sheeps come, up or down the bridge. some fischers too on the river. local people come to take drinkable water here.

name: near Sibiu
description: if you don't want to sleep in Sibiu town you can stay here. Many grassy space  where come some cows. some farms. great view and quiet.

name: Huge lake with planty of space
description: Just a few km off the Transalpina you can find this lake. There is a lot of space in the forest or at the lake. Calm and beautifull. During summer time you will find locals camping here.

name: At Danube River
description: Hiden place at Danube River. Quiet and nice view after dirty road.

name: Reservatia naturala pestera Comana
description: Drive past Comana de Sus on a dirt road until the signboard. It's a nice 1,1 km hike upstream to a rather small cave in the forest above. This looks like a splendid spot to camp - with a river across the road.

name: Near Danube Gorges
description: Flat grassy patch on the banks of the Danube near main road. Fishermen use it, spot big enough for several vehicles. Vegetation offers some privacy from road. Beautiful view of the river and Serbian side. No facilities. Camp fire possible and plenty of firewood around. Very light traffic especially at night, was very quiet when we stayed. Small kiosk about 1km away where you can buy beer and a few basic food items/snacks.

name: Beach Camp
description: Party beach town, grate atmosphere. Restaurants and bars everywhere!

name: Transfagarasan Camping
description: Nice campsite on the southern side of the mountains. Grassy areas to pitch your tent, lots of space for caravans although in July it was packed. Next to the relatively busy road but quiet overnight.

name: Lonely camping next to national Route 6
description: Quiet and save place next to national road 6, 4x4 required if it is wet.

name: Gilau lake
description: pass the bridge,then you'll reach to a hotel ,countinue the route ,at the end of the route there is a place for camping near the forest ,space for 1 or 2 car,quiet place only at night.good for one night.

name: Alexander's Royal restaurant parking
description: big parking lot in front of the restaurant. it was noisy but I found a better place near the parking at the back of the house further away from highway.we didn't try

name: Mircea Voda gas station
description: a parking lot behind the gas satation near by the car service.it wasn't too noisy during night.

name: Delta D.M.Y Hotel
description: located in Mahmudia. view of Delta.good location to get to st. gheorge .the hotel is 1km far from port .friendly staff but they don't speak English very well.

name: wild camping next to a river
description: Big grass plain next to wild little river in the mountains, nice and remote but easy to access via gravel road. there is also a built wooden table for Picknick.

name: Poiana Stanei
description:
For who likes walking, a great place to start from.
We stayed 2 nights there. It's a place known for camping, though very quiet as the area is huge.

name: Rapa Rosie campsite
description: Free communal camp site (grassy field) next to the red Wall / canyon Rapa Rosie in Sebes. Perfect base camp to explore the little canyon, fire places dotted around, garbage bins available, gravel road to get there but you can easy do without 4x4. Locals come here to camp as well. Nice place.

name: Citadel ApartHotel
description: Located by the river site. Good room , kitchen, sitting room and bedroom , bathroom, TV, wi-fi, free parking

name: Pensinuena Valea Cernei
description:
Guest house with a few rooms 10 minutes drive away from the Corvinus Castle.
They let you camp and use facilities. Extremely nice hosts. No food but welcome drink is offered. Tea coffee in the morning but no breakfast.

name: Limanul Resort - Chilia Veche
description: Limanul Resort located in Chilia Veche in the Danube Delta. The location is marvelous and offers the possibility of boat trips within the Danube Delta.

name: Transfagarasan
description: Nice grassy spot near the Transfagarasan famous road.

name: Old Water supply
description: Small camp for two cars and one to two nights with beautiful views of the Carpathians. Occasionally, a shepherd, rarely a car.

name: Piese Auto Import
description:
Good offer of parts with next day delivery. Member of Auto-Telle-Ring Germany.

Phone number +40 736 36 1234

Bought a lot of parts for our '84 Skoda 120LS from here.

Tire shop available across the street and plenty of other parts stores also.

name: place near to Viadru dam
description: nice place near Viadru dam, better than next place that is crowded and full of garbagge.

name: Sarmis Hotel ***
description: Acceptable low price for a room. bed&breakfast, good internet access, good hot shower, A/c in the room.

name: Camping Leon
description: Camping in Durau. Quiet, basic but with warm showers. From here you can start hiking in the Ceahlau mountains

name: Albatros Restaurant
description: A parking place behind restaurant. No more, no less

name: Forest Glen Wildcamp
description: A flat dirt track off of the E60 dead ends here - in a forest glen where two streams meet. The area is used by locals for selective logging. We went down a different track first and there was a local guy with a horse and carriage loading logs. When we were here, this road and this spot were not being used for logging, and we saw no one. Very peaceful and beautiful. No noise except the sound of the streams. Vodafone 3G has strong signal here. Note: as we were leaving on a Sunday we passed through two unlocked, closed gates. We aren’t sure if they are sometimes locked.

name: Grass patches with shade
description:
There are several grass patches with shade next to the road. A few benches and tables here and there. There is a small river nearby but it was almost dried out when we were there in August. 

Signs say camping allowed. When we passed through on the weekend there were some locals. With cars, campers and tents - we only stopped for lunch though.

name: Wild Camp
description: Area with some spots for wild camping. Also rumanian campers around. Beautiful.

name: Backyard of Casa di Duse
description: Backyard of a guesthouse designated for camping. Acess to toilet, shower, restaurant. Lovely, clean and friendly. 40 RON.

name: Streamside Wildcamp
description: Beautiful spot at the end of a gravel track which dead ends at a stream. Surrounded by pine trees. Logging used to take place here, but not currently. Very little trash. Saw no one except 2 people down the road collecting wild berries. There were lots of wild raspberries when we were here. Yum. Very peaceful.

name: Nice Place to be
description: at the DJ113 and near the lake sf Ana the place is clean Caution bear area

name: Cheile Rasnoavei
description: Picnic area on a gravel road, have been there overnight, was very quiet, about 500m further is official campsite

name: Park Cheile Caprei Wildcamp
description: This park is located above the village of Feneș. In the park, there are the remains of old concrete buildings, almost entirely reclaimed by nature. This spot is in a flat meadow, surrounded by trees. Access on a dirt and gravel road. 4x4 required.  High clearance vehicles will hit trees. We are 2.3 meters high and it was ok. Hunters have built a hide and feeding station/trap up the hill, so not a good choice in hunting season. When we were here, we saw no one.

name: Camping Muddy Land
description: Small campground in natural surrounding. Toilet, shower, kiosk. Walking distance to mud volcanos. 25 Lei / car. "Muddy" owner.

name: Zur Deutschen Eiche, Pension & Camping
description: Small, well kept place in the garden of a guesthouse. Wifi. 50 RON incl. elec. Motorcycle friendly place. You can rent a little house with a parking space for bike at the doors.

name: TransAlpina
description: close urdele pass, beautiful view, only sheep and donkys at night very cold

name: Cheile Dobrogei Park
description: Small park with cool rock formations, hills, and meadows. Many options for wild camping - either just off the road or in the hills. Since wild camping isn’t permitted at the Black Sea beaches nearby and the campgrounds were overcrowded, we came here instead. Good choice if you want peace and quiet.

name: Camping Macin- free
description: Camping area in a park behind a monastery. No facilities except pit toilets, which we didn’t use or look at. The signs say there’s a fee of 6 RON per person to be paid in town, but we didn’t read it until the morning and no one was checking at the park. This place is best for ground tents and small trucks with rooftop tents. There is a newly installed gate blocking the road to the picnic area where some locals were camped in ground tents. We camped with our rooftop tent under trees to the side of the gate. Some noise from barking dogs and a gravel mine nearby. Not great, but good enough for a night.

name: Kentaur, Atea
description:
06/2022, charge for a tent: RON 35 pp.
A farm with some huts and a field to park campers or set tents. Clean facilities and large common room with kitchen. Quiet and friendly. EUR 5 or RON 23 per person. Handy as first or last stop in Romania. Follow the road to 'Atea' and then you will see the green 'Kentaur' signs.

name: Pepe motor
description: good helpful mechanic. shop with good assortment of oil, bolts and bits.

name: Alpine Restaurant
description: Good foods on anterence of Transalpine road

name: Costinesti Camping "Cosmos"
description: Nice Place for one week nearby the Beach. friendly and helpful staff. Fast internet...

name: La Releu
description:
This place is on the highest hill near Deva. Above is a big antenna which can be seen from far away.
During the weekends you can meet here some outdoor barbecue enthusiasts but as the evening approaches they all leave. It is not particularly clean, but can be a good place to spend the night in a small tent or biwi. You have to drive up a gravel road that is only about 300m, but it can be challenging for the inexperienced driver. If you find the road too difficult, you can park down and walk the rest of the way. The view here is very nice.

name: Cabana Dorina Campground
description: Nice little family-owned campground directly at a river in the forest. they also have cabins where you can stay. small places for fire available, toilets, shower everything okay.

name: Spot at the river
description: Across from the rotten train carriage, there is a flat bit of land, big enough for a vehicle, right next to the stream. peaceful, very quiet and awesome view.

name: In a field
description: Take the track just before the road bends to the right. Keep driving until you see an iron cross. We stopped right next to it. Beautiful views all around. Very quiet.

name: at cross
description:
Nice wild camp at a picknick place.
At 1340 m

name: wild camping everywhere
description: It's not so much the lake, but the whole track from Polovragi to here is one big wild camping area. The best campspot is at Curmatura Oltelului viewpoint at 1650 metres, 360° roundview over the mountains. You can also hike from up there, or drive to the 67c. At the track from Polovragi to the viewpoint are several campspots alongside the river. From the lake you can drive to Ciungetu and on to the 7A and subsequently on to the 67C to do the best part of the Transalpina. Nice drive all around!

name: Baile Herculane Nationalpark visitercenter
description: parking place of the Nationalpark Visitercenter

name: beautiful view
description: The spot is high on a mountain pass and perfect to camp for one or two nights, if road conditions allow the climb to this spot. Beautiful view over the mountain range. Mobile service works well.

name: near the forest
description: Informal place to spend a night. Large green grass area. Across the street is a restaurant and a  sign indicating formal camping ground.

name: Overnight parking near Peles Castle
description: When asked, the parking guards allow overnight parking. There are any restaurants nearby. Car park is in walking distance to Peles and Pelesior castle and sorrounding gardens. Also in walking distance approx. 2.5km is the Sinaia Gondola which will take you to varies mountain peaks (1400 and 2100).

name: Mures River Wild Camp
description:
Follow the road to the pulley ferry then take the track to the left.
The road runs along sometimes close to the railway but there are spots along here you can camp up.
I chose a recently harvested corn field by the river and not far from the ferry.

2 groups of farmers came past, who waved back when I waved to them.

Lots of dead wood in the bushes for a fire.

Some motorway noise but only heard 2 trains.

Good Vodaphone 3G coverage

name: near the Danube
description: A place to stay one or two nights. Can get a bit noisy as it is close to the road. Local fishermen will come and fish here, though ignored us. There are a few restaurants nearby.

name: Brad
description: Great place has a kids playground across the road we stayed here for a couple of days. It is a very quiet spot as the road is a no through road. The shopping centre is only a 5min walk, also across the road from the shopping centre you have a tool shop selling power tools and chainsaws. Further up the road in the centre of town you find the gold museum.

name: Oradea good overnighter near shopping centre
description: Free overnighter behind large shopping centre. Good internet if you have your own Sim card. There are also toilets and eateries in the shopping centre.

name: River Wild Camp
description: Not an amazing site but it is hard to find wild camping in this area and we had a peaceful evening here. Probably not accessible in high water or smart place to stay after heavy rain up river.

name: Wild camp outside town
description: Stayed here a night before cycling into Braşov the next day. Not completely hidden from the road but we felt comfortable sleeping here for a night. You have to do an easy stream crossing where part of the bridge is gone but it’s nothing difficult. As you continue on the gravel road there are fire pits on the left. We went to the farthest fire pit, farthest from the road which is before crossing a bridge and entering the forest. Only saw a friendly group of hikers in the morning. Not sure how well the spot would work for vehicles. There is plenty of space to park before the damaged bridge, I would imagine you need 4x4 to try and cross the bridge.

name: River Jiu Wild Camp
description: Take the dirt road that leads to a levee. Plenty of spots to pitch a tent along the river. We had a nice night here and never saw anyone.

name: Avrig river side
description: This is a beautiful and perfect flat spot with view on all the western Fagaras mountain range. When we stayed the night, the police came by and they told us it is allowed to sleep there, if we don’t pollute the river. A disadvantage is that the place is popular for locals to wash there car with the river water (which is illegal!). Beware the place can be windy.

name: Camping Bucuresti Belvedere
description:
This brand new camping area is located in between 3 lakes and next to a nice park. The area is currently being transformed in a big recreational hotspot. The owner is friendly and helped us around (even drove us to the city). 
Beware that the city center (Piața unirii) is at least 1 hour by public transport (bus R424 to Depoul Alexandria and tram 32) or at least 30 minutes by car/taxi.
10€/night, hot showers included.

name: Next to the road near Fieni
description: Descent the small dirt road in the bent of the road 71. You will find a flat spot in the orchard. A small disadvantage is that the train passes by on 50 meters, but the train is not too noisy.

name: Riverside Hide Out
description: Hidden little spot in what otherwise is very flat land. Turn off the main road and follow the track that runs on the top of the embankment. There are probably a few different spots off of this track. Be careful during wet seasons as it looks like the water rises quite high. We only saw one car driving along the top of the embankment between 4pm and 11am.

name: The Aviary Stopover
description: We went to the large parking place at the end of the road. Originally we wanted to drive along the embankment track but this is fenced off in several places. Instead we took a track to the right as far as we could. Lots of flat areas around here, some more hidden than others. Unfortunately quite a bit of rubbish too, but very nice if you look towards the river. Didn’t see anyone else apart from a shepherd and his sheep who came by and gave us a wave in the morning. The only noises we heard during the night were all the birds - hence the name.

name: Romanian border
description: Increased border control introduced in April 2019 apparently. There are signposts off the M43 in Hungary for wagons carrying animals and plants. Vignettes are available after border control (coordinates are for the vignette office rather than the checkpoint), but unlike a lot of other countries, difficult to find before the border; pay in Euros or Lei (cash).

name: Silvia Motel
description: 2-star motel with restaurant and small campsite. Camper with 2 people cost 42 lei for the night. Restaurant accepts cards but campsite needs to be paid for in cash. Menu not typically Romanian, but 2-course dinner for two with drinks came to 94 lei. Customer service could've been better, but the campsite is now more big-rig friendly thanks to the lovely Austrian off-road enthusiasts who seem be regulars here and know where the bow saw is kept. Beautiful setting. Shower and toilet are free, clean and delightfully rustic.

name: Moto mechanic
description:
Experienced mechanic with reasonable prices. Can disassemble an engine. Also works on cars.

Did my post-Africa servicing here and I am very happy with the results.

His name is Lucian, +40751649175.

name: Border control
description: Passport check followed by vignette office. Leva or Euros in cash only for the vignette, but there's also a bureau de change and cash point. Staff are super.

name: Ukraine/Romania Border
description: Romania-Ukraine: took 1hr 23mins. Romania passport and then customs - straight forward and quick, one booth for passport control, a second booth for customs (5 meters apart). Ukraine - we got an a6 sized white form at the barriers which they wrote our number plate on. We then needed 3 stamps on the form before we left. After they gave us the form we got directed to a queue. All of the people came to us in our car in the queue. 1st stamp they checked inside the car, then 2nd stamp they took our passport and v5 (car papers) to passport control. They brought all the stuff back with the second stamp on the form. 3rd stamp = customs. They checked our car again and then took passports and v5 again. Brought them back with final stamp and said we could go. We had to give white form to person at final barrier. Place to buy car insurance on the left after you go through barrier.

name: Forest Hideaway
description: Track just off the main road which leads down to the river and various tracks from here. There is a very low train track bridge to go under, but if you turn right before the bridge the track goes a bit further along and you can go over the train tracks, turn left and it takes you back to the original track but on the other side of the bridge. Lots of different potential places to camp here, just follow the tracks until you find one you are happy with! There was a little beach next to the river that would probably be nice in summer. We camped in a clearing in the woods - very sheltered from wind/rain/noise from the trains. A bit of rubbish, but not too bad. We stayed there for quite a few days and only 2 people came past us (walking), a few cars also passed us via the main track but we don’t think they could see us through the trees. In other areas there were old campfires. Great spot! Caution - keep an eye out for ticks!!

name: Nice service area (sells SIMs)
description: nice service area. can park overnight for a small fee. toilets and showers look ok. kids play area. ask in fuel station for sim card.

name: Ibreg
description:
Good place tot visit the museum and zoo.
Close tot shop.

name: FREE BORN HOSTEL
description:
nice hostel , safe parking for motorbike 
11€  shared room 8 bed 
12€ 6 bed
I would recommended it ! and very nice staff

name: zozo hostel
description:
very nice new hostel . 
have parking only for motorbikes I guess . 
12€ shared room 
with breakfast

name: bicyle hostel
description:
nice hostel 
10€ mixed room 
I put the bike outside but safe ..
supermarket very near

name: Lighthouse Tulza
description:
Nice place for a night.
Along the road more places to stay for a night.
fast 4g internet.

name: Rasova
description:
Nice place for a night.
Good shelter under the trees against the sun.
Not possible to swim or take  a bath in the Donau.

name: National Ethnographical Park “Romulus Vuia”
description:
Really beautiful park with all kind of historical (mostly wooden) houses, farms and churches. Brought here from different areas in Romania. In a natural green surrounding. You really get a feel, how a village and it’s houses, might have been, in the old days. You can also visit them inside. 
We stayed here for the night. If you take the road left of the entrance, in a few hundred meters,  there is a really big (unguarded) parking spot with picnic tables. At night there was no-one and it was really quiet.

name: nice place near the river
description: After riding all the day visiting Sucevita and Modovita monasteries and the wonderfull and narrow road we found this nice place near the river.

name: Chelie Rasnoavei
description: Very charming place! Not quite cheap tough - we paid 80 RON for 2 persons, 2 motorbikes and a tent in May 2019. But it is worth its price - situated in the mountains guarantees stunning views! It's really huge spot with all infrastructure necessary - you can organise there an outdoor event. All facilites onsite - kitchen, fridge, washing machine, hot showers, toilets, wifi, electricity. And it's managed by an enchatning woman who speaks perfect English (and probably German).

name: in the field overlooking a valley
description: Nice quiet place overlooking a grassy valley. Just follow the small gravel road from coman. Its narrow but OK to go with some clearance. We parked just beside the road on a flat spot. No cars, just one tractor passed in the morning.

name: Camping Dragus
description: Free municipal campground with solar showers, toilets, water, dump, limited electric (under pavilion) and amazing views. The large area is used for the Freilerner Festival in July (freilerner-festival.de)

name: She’s Green
description: Fabulous vegetarian, vegan and raw food. Even as meat lovers we kept coming back here. Closes at 16.30.

name: Camping Lacu Rosu
description: Nice campsite next to a small mountain pass. Very clean, sanitary. Nice owner and good prices. No electricity but you can buy rabbits.

name: Camping Panorama
description: Very beautiful campsite with stunning view over the mountains. Nice owner. 40 lei per person per night. Can also use their washing machine for 20 lei, very nice service. Only cash

name: Camping Aurel Vlaicu
description: Basic (facilities need an update) campsite with showers, toilets, stove and swimmingpool. Owner is nice and likes to give you some information about the place.

name: Camping Scorila
description: Beautiful campsite, with showers, toilet, fireplaces and hammocks. 20 lei per person.

name: Lacul Horia
description: Nice spot at a small lake. OK for swimming when we were here in June. Some fishermen and just little rubbish. Follow the dirtroad from Balabancea to get here.

name: MotoCamp
description: Great place to meet and stay for motorcyclists! Very cheap, perfect location, nice set-up and extremely friendly owner! He is still at the beginning to set up a big MotoCamp but he’s getting there. The rooms are very nice and very clean, kitchen and bathrooms are nice! Also you can put up your tent in the backyard.

name: Trei Fântâni
description: Quiet place on the river bend. Meadow is large enough for ten cars.

name: View over Bran Castle
description: Beautiful spot on a hill with view over the valley and Bran Castle in sight. Some trees and bushes for shade. No one around. Only cows on a field. Few mosquitoes or flies. The road is a bit hard, only small rocks but it can be done with a small campervan. Actually you can reach it from two streets that lead from the main road. Google maps will NOT find the way! Use maps.me

name: On a freshly mown field in the forest
description: Nice place, easy to reach, but maybe only during harvest season. The grass was freshly mown so there were a lot of bugs and a few mosquitoes but it didn‘t bother us. We had a peaceful night, no one saw us neither we saw someone.

name: Natural Peace & Quiet
description: Along a fishing pond you are surrounded by rolling hills and pristine nature. The grass is cut, the place is absolutely spotless (no trash) and there are little trees, tables and a long drop toilet. There's a good dirt road directly from the main road to this place, accessible with all vehicles (look at Google satellite) Minimum cell reception. Maybe in the weekends there will be fishing going on, but the whole area offers many other wild camp options. A little piece of paradise, where you will only meet some sheep herders.

name: Vidraru lake.
description: Near the lake. The only place where I can camp with a campervan. From the main road at the end of the lake, take left to the gravel road for 7 km. Drinking water few hundred meters. Flat and grass place. Avoid for weekend when there are a lot of people. Take care of bears. Don t leave any food outside.

name: Camping Honigberg
description:
Nice place inside the garden of the parish house and opposite from the fortified church

contact Dan ‭+40 (723) 608 646‬

All infrastructure, best showers ever,  super clean, 72 Lei for two person incl. camper, also guest rooms available, could use the washing machine, bus to the city of Brasov.

name: In the middle of Ceahlău mountains.
description:
For 4WD campers only! Quiet spot after 10 km of gravel road. Many day hikes from here including the popular hike to Toaca summit (1904 m) .
The road start in Bicazul Ardelenesc and you must insert in your GPS the entrance into the Reservation that is few km 49.91757804 25.88388094. There is a barrier with 6 lei tax fee per person. After the barrier switch the gps on foot and enter the final coordonate

name: Camping Poieni Sapanta
description:
Small established campground on both sides of Pension Ana, along a small river. Toilets and hot showers are available on site, or in the pension if needed. Some 3 km south from the Cimitrul Vesel (Merry Cemetery) and small shops in the village od Sapanta. The owner speaks some English, as does his wife. Price per night € 12.- per pitch. Restaurant on site, also for breakfast.

In the evening, the local sheep may roam the streets near the campsite, but apart from the brook it’s a quiet, safe place.

name: Mala Camping
description: Simple and small campsite. Basic facilities, can be crowded in peak season.

name: Clopotiva Camping
description:
I spent only a night with my camper but for sure not the last time. Just an amazing place and for star lovers! take your telescope if you can, ther is no light pollution and a wonderful heaven. And sooo calm.
Super hospitality

name: Tulcea View
description: Very beautiful campsite with view over all Tulcea, reachable by foot with backpack, with car a bit harder because of off-road conditions.

name: Rānca water point
description: Roadside water point with tap on the Transalpine at Rånca.

name: Birch Wood
description: Track leads to a Birch woodland. The track continues on to a hill top field with stunning views. Unpaved road for a number of km a bit rough in places but 4x4 not needed.

name: Pasul Rotunda
description:
Covered table and basic loo is all that is here. 
No water available. 
The pass track nearby gets quite heavy traffic.

name: Azuga
description: water spring, cold water summer or winter, right next to the road

name: Garden for a tent
description:
For those who don't have a car or van to park in train camping, opposite the road lives local family that offers secure spot for a tent. They offer drinkable water and dry toilet. 5 EUR or 20 RON. Perfect for a light motorcycle setup.

It might not be straightforward to understand where it is. If not sure, ask campsite for a place for tent, they will lead to this garden.

name: Aranykakas Restaurant - Pensiune
description: Lovely place on the road to have a lunch. Two people course costs around 60-80 RON. Good for bikes or cars, large parking space available. Free wifi. Cash only.

name: Delta Camping
description: New campsite. Very clean amenities. One price include wc, hot shower , power and wifi. Very close to city centre and boat trips into danuge delta. Very helpful owner and in english.

name: Perfect parking in city center
description:
Parking lot in city center with toilet (Dixie) and wifi. Owner is very friendly and gave us a map of the city. I think the lot is guarded 24h. Some trees here to find a shady spot. Streets around but not too loud. Spent a good night :)
Actually it costs 100 ron (20€) for 24h.

name: On top of the cliff
description: Spot on top of a beautiful cliff. Stunning 360’ view, reachable via path suitable for vans and rv‘s. In the evening a lot of mosquitos.

name: Sheep camp
description: Beautiful grassy place next to the road with a sunset view on the famous road. It is quite cold in the night as it is the top of the hill. Nearby sheep field with multiple dogs walking around. A couple of other cars, vans and tents. Do not need 4x4 to get here, but access is rocky and large size wheels are going to help. Natural water source, drinkable. Wild camp.

name: Balotesti camping
description: Nice quiet place at the Balotesti village. We drove over to the other side of the river, which was shallow in summer, was easy with our wagon. Better than the paid camping in the middle of the village. Water access.

name: Fontaine drinkable
description:
Water source, gute Wasserquelle.
drinkable next to the road.

name: Hotel La Sura Getilor
description: Cheap (15€ for a double room) hotel outside of town, found it online and since it was cold and raining on a motorcycle, this was great. The rooms are clean, 2nd floor, mini fridge, good wifi, restaurant/ bar downstairs, fairly secure parking. I think 25€ if you just show up.

name: Râșnov
description: Quite place at a big clearing in the forest. We drove almost till the end and found a nice place a bit uphill to the right. Therefore 4x4 is recommended. But you can also stay a bit nearer to the road without 4x4. A lot of space for any kind of vehicles. Even on a weekend, we saw only two locals with their cars picnicking. Completely quite at night. Internet signal depends on your spot. We had 4G with Telekom but there are also spots without connection. Lot of shade from trees available. Really clean place. Edit: In the morning (10am) came the really friendly jandarma and said that it is not allowed to camp and make picnic here. At the end it is up to you if you want to risk it.

name: Wildcamp
description: Nice spot in the hills, fireplace available - enough wood around.

name: Casa Hoban
description: Excellent, clean, friendly and cheap B&B. A couple of rooms in a small village. Nearby restaurant. As of 2020 you will be able to camp in beautiful garden. Near the TET route (TransEuropeanTrail).

name: Fireplace and rainproof spot
description: Beautiful spot in the Karpata Hills. Seatspace for 8 Persons with roof. 4G coverage.

name: Spot near ruins
description: Not so remote, but beautiful view over the hills. Hidden from the track.

name: Wildcamp close to river
description: Very large area in the u-bend of the river, away from the road with lots of space to camp. There are places next to river or a little bit away from the river with more shade. Quiet during day- and night time. When we were here some farmers however did use machines making little sounds. Probably to scare off animals during the night. It didn’t bother us though. Take the dirttrack from the mainroad halfway the U-bend to enter the area. There is also a possibility to enter the area via the sand/stone factory.

name: Turtle Camp
description: Very nice campground with good showers and toilets. Price is also good with 25 Leu per person per night. The place is simple but made with love. You camp under many fruit trees

name: pensiune jorja
description: by the centre old but clean.toilet n room rate is cheap Ron 80.   weak wifi in room but better near reception. there are big family room for Ron 130

name: Riverside wildcamp Sighisoara
description:
Campspot at a small river with some noise of the highway, but quiet at night. There is 1 levelled spot where the grass was flattened, probably used by some locals for river access. No one was around though. Further down the track is a large meadow, but in sight of houses and closer to the highway 
with higher grass. Place can be reached by leaving the highway at 46.2266003, 24.7679573, right off the highway if coming from Sighisoara. Take a left to cross under the highway and follow the track along the fields and the river. Best to use Google sattelite. As the track is narrow and deep at some places, good clearance is needed. Grass was flat when we were there, but could be not ideal for camping when not flattened.

name: Apa Cumpanita
description: Nice camping at the end of a offroad track

name: Large meadow wildcamp
description: Very large meadow used by a shepherd living in a trailer with his 10 dogs and sheep. Shepherd was ok with us staying for the night. Friendly dogs. Easy access, also for big rigs. Orange 3g/4g coverage weakens further at the back of the meadow.

name: gringo rocky river
description: plenty of spots by a beautiful river.  just look around.

name: Battery Shop Grozbo
description: Here you can buy new batteries for your car. Super friendly and competent service.

name: Zodiac
description:
Great campground offering full services for campers: showers, bathrooms, electricity and if you are with a camper they have water fill up, place to empty grey tank and bathroom  casette. Its walking distance to beach amd restaurants, yet away from the crowds.
They also have a nice pool.

name: Ridge camp
description: Spot right next to a dirt track on the ridge. You will have a little glimpse over Bicaz lake. One side is sheltered with trees and the other with an nice open view. Peaceful and really quiet. In the morning & afternoon a friendly sheperd came by and also some mountainbikers. You cross a national park entrance, and it seems like you have to pay an entrance fee of 6 Lei p.p. but the counter was closed. The ‘main’ road (DJ155F) to the place is seriously potholed. The last 2,5 km is a dirttrack, becoming a bit more narrow in the end. Campspot is not very levelled, but manageable. Good 4g Orange coverage.

name: Near Neamt Monastery
description: Big meadow surrounded by forest with plenty of spots. In this corner of the field you are out of sight of the (dead end) dirt track. There is also a spot with wooden benches and a firepit but unfortunately with some trash. We just had a friendly sheperd passing by at our spot.

name: Place next to river
description: Beautiful place on lawn next to a river (this season almost no water) where you can spend some nights. A lot of flat space for any kind of vehicle. During day a bit traffic from the forest workers. Completely quite at night. A lot of shade from trees. No mobile signal. 4x4 not necessary, especially when you come from south.

name: Trei Stejari
description: Campsite at a restaurant. Better use the toilets of the restaurant, those of the campsite aren't very clean. Restaurant isn't special but very reasonable prices. We paid about 22€ per night for 6 persons.

name: Little hill
description: Small field on a hill. Hidden from the road with a beautiful sunset if you are lucky. Use google satellite to see the gravel tracks leading to the spot.

name: Wildcamp in the wood
description: Space for 2-3 SUV‘s in the wood. Nothing special- no view- but a remote and quiet spot with enough firewood.

name: Beautiful Spot on the hills
description: Beautiful round-view with low level wind protection (please dig a fireplace to avoid problems and use your vehicle to add more wind protection). Enough Firewood available if you carry a saw.

name: TransAlpina River Ford
description: There is a place to a place between street and river. A flat ford  through the river leads to more places. Vvery nice place!

name: Drinking water
description: Here you can get drinking water out of a natural source. Locals told us that is the best water in the whole region. A lot of locals come here to get water as well.

name: Just off the road, but hidden.
description: In a corner there is an track going away from the road. I camped 100 meters from the road as the track ends but a few flatfish spots around. Hidden from sight by trees and others greens. Old fire places so is used before. Road goes very quite at night.

name: Old turn
description: Looks like the road was here before. Is an old switchback in the road to the  ice cave. Very silent at night and green around. I came from the to there is an opening in the road fence.

name: Poiana Pelegii
description: Nice designated camp area in Retezat National Park. Camping there is for free, but you have to pay a small entrance fee to enter the park (15 lei per car and 10 lei per person). Once you pass the barrier, you still have to drive 20 km over a small gravel road. Takes about an hour, but you don’t need a 4x4. You have to park your car at the parking lot and walk the last five minutes. So only suitable for tents (but with a van you can sleep at the parkinglot I guess). Enough space to put your tent. There is a picknicktable and a rescue centre, where you need to check yourself in. From here you can walk to lake Bucura in 1,5-2 hours.

name: Wide meadow
description: Wide, open meadow in the forest perfect for camping. Tents can be pitched out of sight. Accessible with camper vans, as well.

name: Muzeul Histria
description: Parkinglot from the ruins, the museum and the restaurant; 3-4 RV's possible; both sites are very interesting and each costs 10 Lei pP; the ruins are very spacious

name: Beach Eforie Sud
description: In low season it's possible to stay at the right beach beside the little moorings; a narrow  stony path leads to a flat place for small RV's; 4x4 recommended if you must turn around through the sand

name: Emerald Lake
description: Beautiful spot at the lake and close to the basalt columns.  After turning left towards destination Lacul Smarald, drive past the boulders in the road then turn right and 5m further, turn left, up a slight incline and you have the perfect spot away from other visitors to the place.  We spent 2 nights here.

name: Cosmeştii-Vale
description: On the banks of the Siret river.  Lovely place but a lot of garbage around.

name: Reservoir at border
description:
Go down from the main street along some gravel road through the fields and you will come to the lake. Some nice spots available. Seems to be popular for locals for fishing.

Be careful with EU roaming, you might get the signal from Moldova.

name: QP Pub
description:
QP Pub is a restaurant / bar run by two motorcycle adv riders. 
It’s the friendliest biker spot in Bucharest, Romania. Great food and drinks, bike parking, wonderful parties. 
Most of all though, the conversations with Mihai, Bogdan and/or other bikers almost certain to be there are invaluable. 
They will always and gladly help with tips, routes, places to stay in the country, repairs and mechanic shops - all in all it’s a mandatory stop for anyone on a motorcycle tour through Romania. 
PS: Bikes are always parked in front, the place has constant CCTV.

name: Cabana Carolina
description:
Nice guesthouse run by a young family 
price between 19-25 euros per room
secure privat parking suitable for motorcycles and cars..
Food can be arranged on request 
Shared kitchen free to use
Drinks also avaible on site
wifi avaible pingpong table 
you can contact the owner on his mobile number
0040740284086

name: Motorcycle Museum
description:
awesome museum full of antique motorcycles from all o er the world.

free entry! very cool museum with books in English about the bikes!

name: Wine Domneasca
description:
Very nice hotel.
19€ private room.
I stayed 2 times here. It has a big safe parking in the backyard. 
Nice owner.

name: Centrul National De Pregatire Salvamont
description: Great hostel with breakfast included. Kinda warm showers. 49 Lei for a bunk bed. Plenty of parking for bikes or cars

name: Friends Hostel
description:
Normal hostel with good bed.
Kitchen.
Safe gated parking only for motorbike.
3 Kms from center but Uber super cheap.

name: Pensiunea Poliana
description: Surprisingly upscale roadside hotel on the way west through Romania. Quite nice. Decent restaurant downstairs. Not horribly cheap...ran us about 180 ROM. But it was the only place we found with rooms. Unsecured but monitored parking in front, breakfast included. Nothing too special, just not a whole lot of options around.

name: Guesthouse Casa Cosmin
description:
Nice enough little guesthouse in the small town of Dobra. Very warm, on-site restaurant with pretty great food. We paid 110 RON for one night. Bathroom is shared, but very close to the room. Not much parking, but a motorcycle can squeeze into the garden. If not, there’s street parking. No included breakfast. No English spoken. Still, would recommend! 

No signage though! It’s down a small street with a sign that just says “Restaurant” out front. Small brown gate. Doesn’t look a whole lot like a guesthouse...but it is.

name: Serbia/Romania Border Crossing
description: Border crossing between Serbia and Romania, at the towns of Vatin and Moravita, respectively. Just wanted to add it: painfully easy crossing. Zero checks, barely glanced at the passport. Simply a stamp. Just so you know it’s there! Roads are all good on both sides.

name: Nice, flat area on the river site
description: Nice, flat area on the river site. no facilities just grass and horses

name: Casa Nini Bed & Breakfast
description: Very clean, comfortable and warming place. The host is very experienced overlander and his experiences are amazing especially his extreme expedition in Siberia. Top place!

name: Ceasu Rau restaurant
description: Good Romanian restaurant with delicious meals and fair prices.  A very popular place to eat also for locals.

name: Camping
description: Few different camps all in a row, some just above the sea. Possible to wild camp down on the beach. The camps all have a bar and cafe but not much shade and are dusty. 8 euro for 2 people one tent, ok for a night.

name: Self service Laundry
description: Modern self-service laundry, small and big machines and dryers. Possible to pay cash and card. 10RON small load, 15RON big load, 10RON drying.

name: Fresh spring
description: Spring with fresh water, locals are using it quite frequently

name: Detunatele
description: On the side of the road you can camp. Safe and in the wild. Spring is availabile.

name: Nomad Caravan
description: Camping in Sibiu/ Motorhome parking in Sibiu, having all facilities: electricity, hot showers, toilets, fresh water, waste water discharge, black water discharge, wifi

name: Mures river near Targu Mures town
description: Wild camping near the river and Targu Mures town

name: Wild camping near Enisala fortress
description: Suitable for high clear car. You can camp with tents. Quiet near the lake Razelm. Take the right road before the fortress parking. It is a gravel road.

name: On the route from Sulina to Sf Gheorghe.
description:
If you come with your 4x4 to Sulina don t miss this spot
. You can fish a lot and can camp near the road and the canal. You have  shadows.

name: Masmoto Motorbike Mechanic
description: Alex and his team are very nice and helped us promptly with a problem on our motorbike. They organized parts within hours and we could continue our trip quickly.

name: Hut housing
description: Camping possible..huts are 4€ a night..toilet ans shower..near to Centrum..english speaking..

name: Fireplace hut
description: nice place at the River near a fireplace hut.

name: Hut camping
description: Very nice site with small huts to rent. Close to the city. Lots of good places... very cheap... good accomodation.

name: Aventura Lac
description: nice place with Pool and huts for two..a night 10€..No Card payments!!

name: VAMA VECHE.
description:
It’s an Wild Camp, where á lot of local Campers stay’d!
On the hill overloking the village an the beach. Restaurants nearby. 
Music at night from the village, but Not disturbing. A lot of People.

name: Meadow place with creek
description:
Nice place beneath the transalpina, protectet by trees, easy access for all types of vehicles. 
little creek, fire places, good for one night or more

name: Spot in the forest
description: Place was recommended by villagers. It's a nice forrest where you can put a tent without problem. Road is slippery but accessible with normal car.

name: Wild camp near river
description: Beautiful place near river, wild, open space very quiet and with a splendid view ! The acces to the place is on an unpaved road but is quite accessible even without an 4x4 car!

name: CBB Siebenbürgen
description:
Little chaotic but lovely campground run by a German. It has simple shower/toilet, kitchen, fireplace,...
Some animals running around, donkey, chickens,... 
Camping on a grassy field, most is leveled. 
Washing machine and tumbler also available.
Michael also has horses you can ride if you know how to ride a horse. There are easy trails to walk/ride around the village. 
Two ‘magazin’ (supermarkets) in walking distance in the village.
Water is drinking water quality but with a strong iron taste.

name: Wildcamp at the finest, at the forest of Călugăreni.
description:
Wildcamp at the finest, at the forest of Călugăreni. 
There are huge free grasslands, but also shadows in the deciduous forest. 
No garbage! 
From time to time a few cows or sheep, or the very friendly farmer. No internet.

name: A peaceful place in the floodplain.
description:
Unfortunately, the area by the rivers is often misused for garbage disposal.  There are limited areas here that are free.
4G.

name: Drinking water good pressure, no thread!
description: Drinking water good pressure, no thread!

name: Spring
description: Waterspring with good water.

name: Hidden place at the river, near Valea Viilor.
description:
Your are hidden, but you can hear the road. 
Very quiet during the night. 
In the morning a shepherd past by with his heard and some dog's. H+

name: Transylvania's top hills.
description:
Fantastic view and magnificent rest. 
The shepherd lives up with his family from May to September, 360 sheep and 6 friendly shepherd dogs. 
There's fresh milk and cheese with him. 
It leads a fixed meadow path to the hillhead. H+

name: Cheese & Pancakes - Handcrafted
description:
Here you can get some first class cheese, all handmade from natural regional milk, tasting like Swiss cheese.
60-70 Lei/kg.

name: Hill above Saschiz
description:
On the hill above Saschiz.  
Only accessible in dry weather.  
Nice view over the valley, the fortified church and the whole village.  
Very friendly residents.  
Herd of sheep with sheepdogs.  Everyone warned us about bears that come to the village even during the day.  4G.

name: Roades
description:
Near Roades , fortified church.
Location requires light 4x4.

name: Panorama camping
description: 2km up from the pass of the main road you reach a grassy hill with a perfect panorama view to the national park. Highly recommended especially when the weather is good. Can be reached also by non 4x4. Some locals come to camp nearby too.

name: Rompetrol
description:
drinking water on Rompetrol: free!
they have a hose with a connector that fits on gardena 1/2 ".

name: Riverside
description:
very quiet, near to the river - take care on rainy days!
lot of firewood.
some tracks from quads visible, but no-one was here.
big rigs better take the access up river.
sometimes 4G.

name: Caritas cheese store
description:
Here you can find local produced cheese - swiss style, yoghurt and milk. 
Delicious!

name: Good food, traditionally and fresh.
description:
At this end of the Transfagarashan, good and fresh traditinal food.
Fair prices!

name: A hidden place on a mowed meadow, or ...
description:
A hidden place on a mowed meadow, or under the trees of the orchards.  
Very quiet because it is far away from the noisy streets.  
No rubbish, no wild animals.  4G

name: Lake view camping on a hill -  MAX 3M hight
description:
The lake is quite polluted and during the high season full of camping locals. If you have a 4x4 you can go up this place. It's 5min from the gravel road uphill on a big meadow. If you continue you fill find also a lot of nice spots. You have a great view to the lake and friendly farmers pass by from time to time.

in fact of high restriction with barrier from both sides (north & south) vehicles with more than 3.00 m hight can't reach the spot.

name: Grassy meadow up on a hill
description: 360° panorama. Can be windy. You need 4x4 to reach this place. From the gravel road it is a nice entry to a nice offroad track. Beautiful stars at night. Shepards roam around. Absolutely quiet.

name: Camping la Donut
description: Quiet little family campground with all necessary facilities.

name: Farmland
description: Such a beautiful place with a breathtaking view over the Romanian landscapes. Here and there a shepard comes along with his herd and some dogs, but overall it's totally quite here.

name: Perfect Place at the Lake
description:
Such a great place with a spectacular view. It's calm, but here and there  some tourists come along for taking a photo. Also fishers are around, but they're friendly. The one and other is camping here too and maybe makes a campfire.
Nobody cares, if you're standing here, but you might consider, that everybody will see you. Anyways we felt very safe here.

name: EPIC View
description:
After visiting the Șipote Waterfall, we were searching for a place up the hills and found this one, which is one of the best places in Romania we found so far. The road is a mostly gravelroad or sandroad, bumpy here and there and maybe a bit more diffcult to drive, when it's muddy, but also standard cars are driving here.
There are other people around, also some farmers, but everybody is friendly and you also can make a campfire.

The view is phenomenal and we stood here for 2 days.

name: Perfect Place At The Aries River
description:
This one is so great and you'll find dozens of places along this part of the river. Take care about lots of mud and some areas are swampy, but also standard cars are driving here.
We stood here for 2 days. It's very calm, but other Romanians might camp here and make a campfire.
This area is also appropriate for a bigger rig and the views are very nice.
The nice Chiuca Falls are also in the near, if you're driving along the river up north up to the next crossroad. Keep right and there's a small gravelroad, which you might follow. The waterfall entrance is at the end of this road, where there's also a small parking lot.
If you consider walking to the waterfall, wear appropriate shoes. There are two ways: One up a hill, which is pretty steep and not always easy.
The other one is along the river, where there's a sidewalk at the rocks. Here your feet will get wet and you'll need to balance along a steel-rope. Not easy, but doable and not appropriate for children!

name: Camping Colina - Cluj-Napoca
description:
A lovely little campground outside of Cluj-Napoca on the edge of a forest. Quiet at night, easy to go to town by Uber (4-5€) or Taxi. The owner is very friendly and speaks good English. Fast WiFi all over the place. 
Great hot showers, electricity on sites, little kitchen and washing machine (included). 
Paid 58 Lei for one night in a campervan without electricity.

name: Kaufland
description: Here you can get everything, also in Western Standard!

name: Drinking water at the church, on the third fence from the left.
description:
Drinking water at the church, on the third fence from the left.  
very good water pressure!

name: Arieșeni Valley
description: Over a (7.5t) bridge (our 9t rig worked just fine) off of road 75 right next to the river. Gorgeous views.

name: A hidden place at the little River (caution in rain).
description:
Absolutely quiet, a few cows. Much firewood. No garbage. Several flat and straight places. 
If this place is too small for a big rig, then just drive the way uphill, there are many possibilities. 
Sometimes no internet.

name: A hidden place on the mown meadow (be careful when it rains).
description:
A hidden place on the mown meadow (be careful when it rains).  
Absolutely calm, a couple of cows.  Caution el. Pasture fences.  
No rubbish.  
Several flat and straight places.  Sometimes no internet.

name: Cheile Turzii
description: Ok top of the Hill with a beautiful view into the gorge.

name: Black Sheep Camp
description:
This is a really nice and quiet campground in the mountains. It has a solar shower, running water from a spring, covered fireplace.
Access for small 4x4 vehicles only! . Maximum size is a sprinter I think since there are big trees. To get to this place you have to drive along a river (about 40m) and it gets very steep at the end.

name: Lacul Oasa
description: Directly down at the lake. Locals use it as boat ramp. Perfect.

name: A shaded place at the stream.
description:
A shaded place at the stream. 
Under hazelnut bushes or alders.
No mobile phone reception.

name: Drinking water at left side of petrol station.
description:
Drinking water at left side of petrol station.
Not really good quality, we used it with our filter system.
Good pressure, fits with Gardena connection.

name: Urdele Pass
description: Just passed Voineasa Center (with plenty possibilities to eat) leave main road in a sharp hair-needle turn. Short off-road drive (4WD not absolutely necessary) for a wide open spaces spot with magnificent views.

name: Wildcamp in creek bed
description:
At the creek bed, but 1 m above the water.  
We stood here after a severe rain warning, but it wasn't a problem.  
A busy street during the day, but quiet at night.  
A passable path leads to the water, accessible from two sides.  4G

name: A hidden place directly on the Moldova.
description: A hidden place directly on the Moldova. Good ground clearance necessary, but easily accessible with 2WD in dry weather. H+

name: EPIC Mountain-View
description:
This is an absolutely fabulous place, with a superb view onto the mountains.
You'll need to drive up a hill (on grass), after you left the gravel road.
You'll see the trails (on the left), where you need to drive... just follow them.
Nobody's here and we stayed here for two days.
Possible without 4x4 :)

name: Dobrogea Gorge
description:
Moderator Note: Please note the cautions about the specific location for camping.

In this area you'll find dozens of nice places for staying a night or more.
Please keep in mind, that it's a protected area and it's totally forbidden
to drive up the hills and camp there (even if others will do it).
We did it too and stayed there for a night, but the next morning at 8 o'clock
the police came up and said, that it's not allowed on the hills and we need
to go downhill... there it'll be no problem.

Please also keep in mind, that regularities changed in Romania at 01.09.2020, so better ask.

Anyways this is a stunning place at an open gorge, with great views. Only thing which is bothering are the trucks which are driving there all the day.

name: Bicaz Lake
description:
Easy to access and absolutely great place for a few days. Lots of space for bigger rigs and lovely grassy (with some mud here and there).
You can drive directly to the beach and setup your camp here.
Very calm and mostly tidy (apart some areas, which you could avoid).

Great view onto the lake with a beautiful sunset.
We stayed here for two days.
The police came around and said nothing, so it'll be no problem to camp here (as there where a few other campers with much bigger rigs, also)

name: Shady meadow
description:
A shady meadow under fir trees, with lots of open spaces, but unfortunately also garbage.
Quiet at night. 4G+

name: Cheile Dâmbovicioarei
description: Just at the edge of the village before the toll road into the gorge. Nice view and level ground.

name: Quiet place at the lake!
description:
some fishermen, one shepherd during the day, in the night absolutely quiet.
an elder lady passed by and told us, that this is private property, we can stay here but we are not allowed fishing. 4G.

name: Hidden place on the sandbank of the river
description:
Hidden place on the sandbank of the river.
A lot of different spots, in the night absolutely quiet.
During the day you can hear the road, but you are not seen.
if you don't need a shade but free sight, go river up to:

45.562620°N 27.506190°O http://maps.google.com/maps?q=45.56262%2C27.5062

sometimes 4G.

name: fish restaurant dasmin
description:
good and fresh food, reasonable prices!
trout and carp, chicken and pork.

name: Meadow and forest.
description:
you are not seen from the road, but you can hear it.
Quiet at night. several spots, even with shade! 4G.

name: MAN Bus & Truck Service
description:
perfect service in short time!
Andrej is the boss of the workshop and speaks good English!

name: Drinking water at Rompetrol
description:
Drinking water at Rompetrol.
Medium quality and pressure.
1/2" hose.

name: Riverbed
description: Where the locals fill their drinking water, fish and camp. Currently (September) rivers carries low water so the riverbank is a perfect place to spend a quiet night.

name: Danube Riverside
description: Wide open spaces alongside the Danube river. Just before entering the port (river crossing to Ukraine) take a left onto a dirt road which opens up the river banks. Some locals around for fishing and camping. Horses, cows and (calm) stray dogs roaming around.

name: Down at the water
description: Secluded beach (gravel). Access via bumpy dirt road (when wet definitely 4WD needed). Only few fishermen around. 3G coverage.

name: Vadu Beach
description:
The beach is in the Danube Delta Biosphere Reserve being the southern end of a long beach over 15km. Legislation says that in order to enter the beach legally a permit has to be purchased. The fee per person is 5 lei per day or 15 lei per week. The fee per car is 10 lei per day. You can pay online: http://ddbra.abt.ro

You will also find a splendid beach restaurant called Cherhanaua Vadu Pescarilor

name: Ivanetu - grassy place
description: For those with 4x4, I recomand this very quiet and clean place. There is a steep way for 1,5 km only from the main road.

name: RO/BG border
description:
BG-RO done in less than 5 minutes. You need a „Roviniete“ (road toll). It’s easier to buy online in advance (no sticker!) than to buy at the border.

https://www.roviniete.ro/

RO - BG: easy! 
You need a „vinetka“ for ALL roads in BG. We didn’t see anywhere to buy at the border. You should theoretically buy one at the next petrol station (it’s digital, no sticker), but it’s easier to do it in advance online:

https://vinetki.bg/

name: Edelweiss guesthouse
description: Guesthouse, camping and glamping on the international rout EuroVelo6

name: MÂgoaja, Romania
description:
Off-road trail up to camp. Big ruts. Big wheels and proper tires needed. 
Place for many overlanders. Nice views.

name: Rodica's guesthouse
description:
Very friendly hosts with lots of information on the area, possible parking inside for motorcycles and a car and great views from the windows!
I found the place accidentally and i was pleasantly surprised! 
100 RON/night/room with wifi and hot water and common kitchen,and big common areas.
Rodica's phone number: 0767 805 541

name: Riverside
description: Among the mountains. Couple of spots to stay. Might be some logging activity passing by. Otherwise beautiful place.

name: Picnic pull off without view over the lake
description: Pull of next to the road with some picnic benches. We spent the night some traffic but very little a night.

name: Walnut Orchard - Livada cu nuci
description: Private property, orchard with lawn, surface of 2500 m2, running water, electricity, outdoor toilet. an ideal place for camping cyclists, motorcyclists, motorhomes. no money, just attention and cleanliness on departure.

name: GS Explorer / The Bat Cave
description: BMW Motorrad official partner. Motorcycle workshop and tourguide in Romania and the Balkans

name: Border post
description: Border post to leave EU. Officially, dogs are not allowed to cross at this border but we begged and they let us cross. bike paperwork and passports processed as expected. Quick process.

name: Crisul River
description:
The lake is formed by a dam. The place is OK to spend the day and camp and sleep at night. Nice and clean water to fish and swim. 
Some fisherman around but quiet and silent tonight. 
Large place for big and small cars or rigs. Sadly the locals leave a lot of garbage around turning a wonderful place a little ugly.
Please keep all places clean. So everybody can use them.

name: Transafagarasan Mountains
description: There are some spots used for picnics. You can use them to park and sleep at night. Beautiful view from the mountains. There is a little pond with clear and chilly water. Lot of garbage around, left by the locals. Please keep the place clean.

name: Near beach
description:
Many spots for small cars and big rigs also. Beautiful sight of the beach just below. You can choose your place and stay for as many days as you want. We arrived on a Friday and there were only a few people.
You can talk to the fisherman at the beach and ask for fresh fish.
Quiet and perfect to spend a weekend or some days.

name: Near Macin Mountains National Park
description: Large area adjacent to the "Măcin Mountains National Park". Not inside the park itself. No fees required. Great views, accessible by short dirt road for any type of vehicle (including large motorhomes). Hiking trails start very close by. I think open fires are discouraged by ranger, fine with barbeques. Large trash bins available. No other amenities. Ample space even during the weekends, perfect for tent camping by motorcycle.

name: Pension
description: Great place to stay. Super nice owners! A place for 2 bikes inside, more outside. Not crowded and quiet area. Very big apartment with AC and separate bedroom. Super clean and cozy. Kitchen with everything to use for everybody. We paid for 2 people about 100 L (23 Euro) in June 2021. Fast Internet.

name: Vila Maria
description: Great place to stay. Safe, closed parking for bikes. We paid 85 lei for double room. Few options from 75 to 150 lei for two. Very clean. Kitchen available. Internet is working.
